content.detailedDescription:
My mom and i were on our way home from a party at my grandparents' house. 
we were about 5 minutes away from our exit, and i saw something out the right side car window.
i thought i was just seeing things... but i wasn't.
there were three star-like, small, things, that would fade in and out at a regular half-second or so interval. 
they wove in and out with each other, too.
i made quite sure that it was not a reflection. i checked many times.
after concluding that i was actually seeing something, i just watched in disbelief.
it only lasted about 15-20 seconds, and when it disappeared, it faded out and didn't come back.
after it was gone, i felt a jittery kind of fear, like when you feel an unwanted presence.
now, i didn't actually feel any presence, but it was just that sort of fear.
the teary, creepy, jumpy kind of fear, with adrenaline. 
the picture attached is an example of how these things were weaving. they were moving from left to right(relatively).
content.summary: Three "shooting-star" like things, weaving in and out with each other, fading in and out at regular intervals

content.detailedDescription: After leaving a movie at aventura mall, in aventura florida, my boyfriend and i went to his car on top of a parking garage. it was then that we noticed something gliding at a slow, constant speed,  across the sky. the ufo was in the shape of a boomerang, and it was very large. i thought that maybe it was a plane but it did not resemble any plane in existence. i did not see it as having any lights, and it was completely silent. the edges of the ufo seemed to be rippling. it was very low, almost as if it had just taken off. i watched it for a good 5 minutes before it blended in with the night sky and disappeared completely. i was never afraid of the object, but i was very curious.
content.summary: Boomerang shaped ufo slowly gliding over aventura area, very low and silent.

content.detailedDescription:
All photos:
*(link moved to additional evidence section--cms/sg)(
 
story

----
ok, i went for a hike today w/ my buddy. when i got back home, i hit the hot tub to chill out. i was sort of in a half dose and half meditative relaxed state, my head resting back. i opened my eyes and was looking up at the skylight and saw what looked like 12 or so white balloons floating way, way, up. i sort of did a double take and said *(acronym deleted--cms/sg).

i jumped out of the tub and on to the deck. i looked up and found them again. they started making formations. then they formed a diamond and pulsed. i ran into the house and asked my daughter to drop the camera down to me. she had her headphones on doing her homework and said the battery is dead. i said drop it down anyway! she said i don't know where the camera is. i said it is right on your desk in front of you where you last left it! she said i don't see it. geesh! teenagers. i ran upstairs, grabbed the camera sitting right in front of her face and ran back down and out on to the deck. i looked up and whew! they were still up there.

i looked through the viewer and couldn't see *(content removed--cms/sg). just blue sky. so i pointed in the direction i could see them w/ my naked eye and started shooting and hoping.

let me tell you these suckers were way up there!

you will notice there are some shots that are just blue sky where i clear missed altogether.

at first i thought these looked exactly like the "balloons" we saw over manhattan on oct 13th. it wasn't until they started making formations that i did a double take. then, like i said, when they formed a diamond they pulsed. i said to myself - *(content deleted--cms/sg).
it is weird when looking at them, i was like - am i really seeing this?

i also called up to my daughter to come down and take a look at this. she plain out said no. she wasn't interested.

i then called down to my son and his cousin (teenagers) in the basement and told them to come up and have a look.

when they got up to the deck they said they couldn't see anything. i pointed in the direction and told them what cloud to use as a reference. then after a bit of some intense looking my nephew saw it. at that point they were forming a line one above the other. he said wow - how did you ever see that - they are so tiny.

then my son saw them as well. first thing he said is - are they satellites? i said - do satellites make formations?

i also said when i first saw them i counted at least 12.

i'd say the whole time they seemed to hover at the same altitude which appeared very high. if it were night, judging distance, they would have been at the visual height of stars.
content.summary: Orbss over colorado springs november 6th, 4:30pm-5:00 mdt

content.detailedDescription: While taking my dogs outside for the last time of the night, i noticed an object in the sky that had flashing red and white lights.  it was at a distance but still close enough to distinguish the different color lights.  i asked my wife to come outside and see what she thought and she agreed with my assessment.  also, she noticed another similar object nearer the horizon.  the direction of the objects was ne from our location. we observed the two objects, in stationary locations in the sky for more than a half an hour (they are still there as i write this).  objects look very similar in size and shape (v) and with pulsing red/green/white lights.  one of the objects that appears to be higher in the sky (closer?) is in the direction of the sequoyah nuclear plant.  the objects/lights are definitely not from a plane and do not appear to be celestial as we (wife and myself) can find no other comparable objects in the sky.  will continue to monitor the objects as long as possible.  planes have flown through the sky (identifiable via their light patterns and their movement) and none seems to have approached or noticed the objects.  unfortunately, we do not have a telescope or a camera capable of taking night photos.
content.summary: Stationary, v-like objects (2) with flashing red/green/white lights

content.detailedDescription: On the deck of my childhood home, i was leaning back against the railing while gazing straight up at the stars. it was a very clear night, the magellenics were quite visible. from my perspective, the point at the top of the roof of the house was just above my gaze (i.E., in the direction of my forehead in reference to the eyes) and dead-center in the middle of my field of view. a light emerged from over the top of the house at what seemed to be an extremely high altitude. it made no noise, so i thought it might be a satellite. but then a "feeling" of sorts came over me during which the thought went through my mind, "you're going the wrong way - turn around!" as if in response to the thought, the object did exactly that - just like a yo-you that never fully stops, it was going one direction one moment and the complete opposite direction the very next. it disappeared behind the top of the house from whence it came and i never saw it again (that i'm aware of).
content.summary: High, slow-moving - it seemed to hear and respond to my thoughts

content.detailedDescription: I answered the door to find someone there who was trying to sell me a new roof.  i looked out over his shoulder to the southeast, and there was a swath of  light...I told the guy to look at it, and he said "wow, i guess we should watch the news tonight".  it was shaped somewhat like a paint swath, wider than any contrail i have ever seen.  for a second or two, i thought it might be a meteorite, but it was awfully wide...Say as wide as your thumb would be at arm's length.  immediately it was clear that it was not an aircraft, no contrail, nothing, and moving very fast.  it was about 30 degrees above the horizon when i first sighted it, and i watched for about 30 seconds, then turned to go get my camera.  by the time i got back, it was gone.  i have no idea whether there are any satellites in this area or not...Or what they would look like.  it was not yet beginning to get dark, so i know it wasn't a star; anyway, it was moving!  so if anybody out there knows how to check whether we had a satellite passing over the southeast of antioch, i would appreaciate that info!  when first sighted, it was about 25 degrees above the horizon...
content.summary: 2 minute sighting of light in the sky

content.detailedDescription: As my daughter and i were soaking in the hot tub, we noticed a strange looking light in the east sky. as we observed this light, it grew into two lights. at this point i thought, this is a plane coming right at us. however, as it progressed, i knew, this was not a plane. it was very low and silent as it went right over head,not to mention, it was moving way to slow.As it was directly on top of us, a third light was present. two in the front and one in the rear. it was in the shape of a triangle, with the flat part of the triangle being the front of the craft. we continued to watch it, excitedly, until it continued west out of sight. if only i had the dvr out with us!
content.summary: Silent triangle light formation

content.detailedDescription: I was with some friends at an outdoor concert, while waiting for the main act to go on (i was getting bored) i was looking up at the sky and noticed a light way up above. the light was way too high to be an airplane (almost looked like a star) but it appeared to be moving so i quickly insisted that my friends look up as well. i've seen many shooting stars in my lifetime so i know when i see one- and this was definitely not a shooting star. then came my friends hypotheses: "maybe its a plane" one of them said, but there were no flashing lights and the white light was way too high up to be an airplane. as we continued to watch another friend suggested that it could possibly be a satellite. only seconds after she said that the light suddenly dissapeared and then reappeared again, but this time going in the opposite direction. it went in the opposite direction until it reached the point that we first noticed it at and again dissapeared from view. i was very excited after seeing the object, but i wasn't suprised or scared. my friends seemed interested, and one of them slightly scared, but i assured them that there was nothing to be afraid of and that if what we saw was a "ufo" it is a good thing! :)
content.summary: Circular light moving across sky, too high to be an airplane, not flashing, disappeared & reappeared in sight twice before switching directions and again disapearring from view

content.detailedDescription: On oct. 6, 2010, i was driving with my wife and daughter,traveling toward victorville, ca on i-15 southbound about 10 miles south of barstow at 8:44 pm when we saw a triangular shaped object at about 100 feet above the ground,slightly to the right of the freeway, and just under maybe half a mile ahead.  it glided out over the freeway and then off to the right again, slightly, moving slower than the freeway traffic  (70 mph). as we were on the freeway, with other traffic, we passed by it slowly (directly underneath it, my wife,yesi, and daughter could see it out their passenger side windows).  it continued off toward the north over the hills, then turned toward the west, about a half mile north of the freeway and traveling at the same rate of speed as the freeway traffic.  as i could only look occasionally, they continued to watch it for approximately 2 minutes.  the craft was a perfect triangular shape with three bright lights shining straight down from the bottom at the corners and a small red light on what we assume is the back of the craft.  this red light was obscured by the craft itself when it turned and headed west.  it was pretty dark, but we could definately see the horizon still.  the craft itself was hard to make out except for its lights.  when it headed west, the three downward facing lights went out and the thing turned into a pulsating ball of light for 20 seconds, maybe, then it got very bright, very large, and simply disappeared.  we couldn't believe what we were seeing, we couldn't believe we didn't have the camera!  the odd and perhaps strangest thing of all is that we very recently became very interrested in the whole ufo phenomena.  we watch shows like ufo hunters and have seen video similar to what we saw that night which made it even harder to believe.  you know, come on, realy?  are we hysterical?  no, we know what we saw and felt because we did't have anything other than our testimony, it wasn't worth reporting.  but we definately started looking for any other reports like ours on the internet.  then we found a video on youtube.  i don't know whose it is but here's an address for the video: *(link moved to additional evidence section--cms/sg).  we feel that this is exactly what we saw.  and until we found this video we weren't realy interrested in reporting what we saw, but now we feel compelled.  whatever is depicted in the video performs, looks and glowed, and disappeared precisely the same way as the craft we saw on oct 6,2010.
content.summary: Triangular shape over freeway, turns into ball of light, disappears.

content.detailedDescription:
On halloween evening, my daughter, my neighbor and i were standing at the end of my driveway handing out candy to trick-or-treater���s. 

at one point all three of us observed a line of 4 reddish-orange lights emerging slowly from behind the trees to the north. i saw what appeared to be a 5th reddish-orange light trailing the other four at a little distance, but when the group of 4 emerged into our line of sight i no longer saw the 5th light. 

the 4 lights traveled as if they were attached by a string, that is, the distance between them did not vary at all as they moved. perhaps this indicates that they were attached to a craft of some sort, but none was visible. 

the lights traveled very slowly, from right to left, across our line of sight in a westward direction. as they moved far to the left they dimmed and flickered out, one by one, until they all disappeared. i tried to take note of whether they passed behind a cloud, and i don���t think that was the case. 

as far as distance and altitude, i can only say, and my daughter agrees, that they were quite a distance away, maybe one-half to one mile. they were above the tree line, so maybe a thousand feet or so altitude, given the distance. none of us heard any sound from this craft, if that���s what it was, but given the distance from us, that���s impossible to determine. 

my neighbor dismissed this whole thing, saying they were ���balloons���, but that doesn���t make sense. i���ve been thinking about this and decided it���s definitely out of the ordinary, so decided to report it. my daughter agrees.
content.summary: Group of reddish-orange lights moving slowly across the sky.

content.detailedDescription: Looking up and to the east a bit i noticed a star like object moving across the sky south to north the sun was not up yet and i could see the sun shinning of of it . all of a sudden it went out and 10 seconds later i could see it moving again then it started to slow down and moved across the sky slower and slower until it stoped .I watched it as long as i could unti i could not stand the pain in my neck . i was on my deck and watching the last bit of night sky befor the sun came up . after it went out and came back on and was slowing down i was waving at it and i felt happy to see it
content.summary: I was watching the sky  a star like object was moving across the sky south to north

content.detailedDescription:
on thursday october 28, 2010; i was at 12300 atlantic avenue in lynwood, california approximately 9:00 am when i glanced up for no apparent reason (possibly instinct) and noticed a small metalic faceted oval cylinder cruising silently eastward. 
     the object was traveling in a perfectly straight line and was definately not a balloon.  it's speed was too slow to have been a winged aircraft.  it was too silent to have had a mechanical motor.  it was above normal helicopter traveling altitude and below jet liner altitude.
     believe it or not, i just stopped watching the object because it was not interesting as i did not feel threatened, curious or confused by it. 
     it wasn't until a few minutes later that i told my friend that "i think i saw a ufo".  
     i'm an ameteur astronomer with a telescope, and i saw a "shooting star" (meteor) and a satelite this morning about 5 a.M. just before i remembered my ufo sighting and decided to report it finally now an hour later.  so i'm familiar with objects in the sky during the day and at night.  ask someone if they've ever seen a star during the day (other than our sun).  very few people even know that you can see a star during the day.  i've have piloted a single engine piper cub and have flown many times in a passenger jet to other countries.  i also am familiar with mechanics and physics and i know that what i saw was not a bird, balloon, airplane, uav, helicopter, or satelite.
     just for the record, although i've watched every ufo documentary in te last 30 years, i am a partial skeptic of ufo's.  i believe in the phenomena of people seeing and experiencing "ufo's", but i do not believe in biological alien beings from outter space.  earth is privileged to have a moon not too close and not too far, a sun not too close and not too far, an ozone layer, a "salt water" ocean, just the right ratio of sea and land,just the right amount of volcanic/platectonic activity, and tree with a special nut that only one creature on the earth can open it so that it can root and grow another tree (so which came first . . . the tree or the creature ?) the list of these privileges goes on and on.  the possibility and probability of any other planet having all these necessary combinations for life to survive and thrive is nill.  as is we are destroying our own planet just by our very existence.  we are destorying our ozone, forests, oceans and extincting many species of animals.  damage or destroy just one of these privileges and life will cease on earth.
     what i do believe however, is that there's a global conspiracy of black projects with black funds to create aircraft for the world to see in order to create a virtual foreign invader.  humans cannot get along, but if we have a common enemy, then we will drop our differences to join forces and defeat our enemy.  a professor once told us that the world will never have peace from war without leadership. 
     we need a hostile common enemy from literally out of this world to get all the nations of earth to join together under a one world government.  hence, the black projects from black funds.  even your very own site mentions how president reagan told the russian president that an alien attack would get warring nations to join together.
content.summary: A small metalic faceted oval cylinder was cruising silently eastward above average helicopter altitudes.

content.detailedDescription:
I was sitting with my kids and we were watching tv,and my wife came in and said "*(wit's name deleted--cms/sg) come and see this"! i was like "what"! she said "theres a ufo in the sky"! so i grabbed my video cam and came outside and was kinda shocked at what i was looking at it was red then changed to orange it kinda looked like a orb so i began to film it.It was kind of starlike at times and was quiet and made no noise like a airplane would i did make reference to it being a flying saucer because when i was filming it to the naked eye it kind of looked like a saucer when it passed over us and the ground had a kind of wierd vibration and the dogs in my nieghborhood were all barking it was very strange.After the object passed i remember thinking wow!I felt like it was a gift to get to see somthing like this and to film it was a plus! thank you
*(wit's name deleted--cms/sg)                           
*(link moved to additional evidence section--cms/sg)
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Other
content.shape: Circle,   Diamond,   Fireball,   Flash,   Star-like,   Other
content.summary: It was a reddish orange star looking object that was moving fast.

content.altitude: Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription: 2 ufos moving and hovering around for about a week so far, one looked silvery or mirror-like with red and white lights, and was about as high up as an average plane flies.  the other was farther away, and whether it was the color or the lights, looked a little orange.  both were disk-shaped, and hovered, as well as flying in all directions, one did a figure-8, but remained mostly in the same place.  they're still out there.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering,Other
content.summary: 2 ufos moving around a little and hovering over about a week.

content.detailedDescription:
I was attending a friend's birthday party in san manuel, az, on november the 5th 2010. at around 8:20 or so, i know this because i text my mother as it was happening. anyways, at 8:20 my friend and i noticed a multi-colored flashing light above the mountains to the north of town. we called his dad to come out and check out the lights, because we wanted someone else to see it. as his dad came out, we heard the sounds of jets. then 3 jets appeared from the south/south east of town. the lights then began to move toward the west, and as the jets got closer to the lights, the lights just shot off to the west. we watched as the jets tried to catch it, but to be honest i don't think they are going to. 

just to clarify, i am 18 years old, and not a believer in this kind of thing. my dad is a believer, and i always give him grief about it. i won't any more. he reported the same thing a year ago, or so. so this is not the first time this has happened over san manuel.
content.summary: Multi-colored lights chased by military jets

content.detailedDescription: We were coming up on 17, heading southbound on 23 when a bright orange ball appeared in the sky south of us. it was cloudy but the object was visible behind the clouds, as it was bright. it appeared to be fairly low in altitude. the object was pulsing, though it wasn't that obvious. object moved east towards culver for a short distance then became stationary for the next 5 minutes or so. disappeared suddenly. very bright and was definitely not a normal aircraft. at first i thought it was a large meteorite....But it was devoid of a tail and wasn't moving fast enough. the timescale and ability to remain stationary ended that idea. we were all calm but curious. was the first object i've ever seen
content.summary: Bright orange ball showed up south of the 17 and 23 intersection. appeared suddenly (was cloudy), moved then became stationary. pulsed for first 2-3 minutes.

content.detailedDescription: Est/central time zones-so.In, 1cigar shaped light appeared--following my dad's car.  on n.E. horizon, dad stopped car--light stopped also--rolled down windows of car on passenger side--not a reflection.  dad started moving car--light followed and went behind some trees--2 lights emerged from trees--dad stopped car--lights stopped. dad driving again, lights moving again.  the 2 lights again went behind trees; 3 emerged and followed us (there were 5 of us in the car)almost until we got to new albany.  we were traveling on old vincennes rd. from pekin, in to new albany.  summer nights were a little longer because of being right on the 2 time zones.  it was early evening, summer, the sun had not gone down, but it was early dusk to twighlight. i was about 9 and can remember the event as though it happened yesterday. my sister remembers my dad mentioning something about the airforce or the government, but i never saw glowing cigar shaped lights that stopped when our car stopped like that before or since. were experiments being carried out?  were there other sightings in that area in that time frame? it was '67 or '68. i was 9 or 10. i will never forget it, but there was definitely no missing time. we first noticed it over the old, old graveyard on the road--just there suddenly.  i thought it was a ufo right away--we had been hearing about them in the news.  for awhile during my adult life, i thought maybe they were ghosts(?) because of the proximity of the graveyard.  my parents never talked about it, but i can still see those lights as though it happened yesterday--all 3 lights went behind trees on the horizon just before we got to the city limits of new albany and never came out. we didn't see them leave except to go behind trees.
content.summary: This happened in southern indiana--floyd co

content.detailedDescription: My husband went outside to check out a strange noise....Sounded like a plane flying really low....He went out and called me to the door....Up in the sky there were 6 lights in a line....The sound then stopped and they went all different directions, all except one that stayed put....They flew all around the sky making circles and moving back and forth and in loops and flying across the sky. one of them flew over behind us and stopped and was fading in and out, in and out and one of the other ones flew around it. then they just started to disappear into the sky. the one that was blinking got really bright and then faded and was gone. scared us terrible. never seen anything like it before!
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Bright lights flashing, flying around, making unbelieveable turns

content.detailedDescription: It was an extremely foggy and cloudy night. it had just rained and you could barely see twenty feet in front of you with your headlights on. i was driving from jaffrey(new hampshire) to rindge (new hampshire), on my way to bring something to a friend of mine in rindge. as i was driving by pool pond(a lake on the edge of rt. 202 in rindge)i noticed a light out of the corner of my eye, and the top right corner of my windsheild. it was shining through the thick fog over the pond and rose over the tree tops and looked to be going about thirty mph or so(hard to tell)but it was long enough for me to know it was not an airplane or a star. it was a sphere of light that just looked very abnormal to me. i think it was a large object because it was approximately a half mile away. but the circumference of the light was an inch wide, from my view. i haven't seen anything like it. i was confused to what it could have been. i only saw it moving for a few seconds but it just disapeared into nothing after i saw it.
content.summary: A sphere of white light

content.detailedDescription:
Last night, after picking my 18 yr old son up from work, we were walking in from the car and stopped on the path in the front yard to look at the stars and planets for a minute.  i was pointing out to him how bright venus is in the sky this time of year.  while doing this, we suddenly noticed a very large object moving very fast from the west toward the east, almost directly over our heads.  
  the object was a giant "v" shape (like a boomerang) and there were no lights on it.  however, there were several (i think 5 or 7) large circular shaped parts on the underside of the object that we could clearly see which looked a little like like giant headlights that would shine straight down but that were not on.  it proportion to the boomerang shaped object, the circular parts seemed to be rather large and take up a good portion of the width of each leg of the "v".  it was dark and we could not see the color of the object nor what it was made out of. it didn't seem "reflective" or that it was made of metal or glass, but we couldn't be sure because it was so dark and it was fairly high in the sky.   
  it was completely silent and it moved very fast but smoothly through the sky.  it simply made a straight line path in its movement from the west toward the east- no turns that we could see. it seemed to be a consistent hight the whole time too- not moving any higher or lower as it moved along.  
  it happened so quickly that all we could do was point at it with our mouths open and say, "what in the world is that?"  then it was out of our sight.  we quickly went inside the house and then found out that we both saw the same exact thing.  we both drew and described the same thing when we compared our perspectives on what we just saw. unfortunatly, since we were walking in from the car, we didn't have a camera with us to film this.  also, it just happened so fast that i don't believe there would have been time to film it. 
  we both felt very curious and a little excited.  we both had a very hard time sleeping after that, but mostly , i just want to know if other people saw this object too.  is there anyone i can talk to about this?
content.summary: My 18 yr old son and i saw a giant "v" or boomerang shaped object fly silently over our heads from west to east

content.detailedDescription: I went out on my front porch for a cigarette before going to bed. i watched an airplane go by on the way to o'hare airport traveling east to west.. then i saw the blinking light coming toward me from the west. at first i thought it was an airplane since i live near the airport. it appeared to be moving about two to three times as fast as most of the airplanes i see flying around. i also thought that it was at a really high altitude, although at night it is hard to judge how close something might be. it was flying in a relatively straight line until it came close to passing overhead. at that point it began to make strange movements. it continued to move in the same general direction, but it would also slow to almost stopped and then speed up to where it would have been if it hadn't slowed down. it also made a quarter circle movement off it's flight path and then moved sideways back. then it started weaving side to side and made other circular movements. by this point it had passed over head and was east of my house. it's blink rate changed for two cycles and then it changed course and made a more pronounced arc like movement and disappeared into the cloud cover. the entire time, i did not hear any noise from it. i fly model airplanes and helicopters, so i am familiar with the types of movements aircraft can make. i have never seen anything make the types of movements i witnessed as it passed over head. i went inside and checked the time. then i went to bed. i hope someone can tell me if this strange event was just an atmospheric effect on a regular aircraft or something not known. i do not necessarily believe what i saw to be extraterrestrial, but it did not appear to be any aircraft i know of.
content.summary: Single blinking light with eratic movements

content.detailedDescription: Me and my girlfriend were sitting in the garage waiting for trick or treaters.  there were alot of cool looking clouds looking west.  my girlfriend tells me to look at this weried cloud.  she points at it and i see it.  it looked like a pencil. the clouds are horizontel but this was vertical too the clouds.  within a couple of minits some bright object came from behind this pencil shaped cloud.  we were not expecting that too happen.  once it came out it hovered next too that odd pencil shaped cloud.  about 30 seconds later i go to get sum binocluars. was in house for a minit.  couldn't find them, so i came back out by that time it was gone.  my girlfriend tells me the object that came from behind the clould went north all quick and was gone.  seconds later she looked for that cloud but it was gone.  our feelings were perplexed. just was wierd
content.summary: My girlfriend saw a pencil shape towards the west it looked out of place and  sum thing came out of it

content.detailedDescription: At about 1:30 am i was laying in bed watching t.V. out of the corner of my eye i saw bright lights out of my bedroom window. when i looked over the lit up object was dropping in height very quickly. i thought i was seeing a plane crash. it looked unussually close for a plane and was so loud i could hear it. i stood up and got closer to the window and it stopped dropping and hovered for a couple seconds. i noticed its ring of lights and its strange, hollow-like (saturn-like), shape. within seconds it took off into the fog like a slingshot and i could see the lights disapearing in the distance. once i realized what i just saw i woke up my boyfriend and brother in a panic. i went over it in my head trying to find another explanation, but there isnt one. it seemed like it came out of a movie and i couldnt believe what i had just saw.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path then hovering
content.summary: Bright lights, lowered in sky then hovered and took off like a sling shot.

content.detailedDescription:
I was lying in bed and just looking out at the early morning sky, it was still dark and i could see a few stars. i noticed all of a sudden a small round bright light flash in the sky, it was little bigger than a star, at first i wasn't sure if there was an overcast and thought maybe it could be a light from a plane that briefly appeared through a cloud. but a few seconds later i notice another simliar one in a different area of the sky, not too far away from the first one. i got out of bed to take a closer look to see if there was an overcast sky but there wasn't, it was very clear. i wanted to sit and observe to see if i could see another one. i went briefly to talk to my daughter and just as i came back to sit down i saw a streak of what looked like a meteorite, it was so different from a shooting star and almost looked like it had a firey tail to it. i said omg, three time because it looked so amazing to me. it was in the same vicinity as the two lights. it came sideways and thought it was strange the way it moved. if this makes sense the lights i had seen earlier were higher than this streak of light but all were in the same viewing area.   

i would like to mention that previously (not sure about how many months ago or the date) i had seen a similar round light that was much larger than the two i saw this morning, and was told that it could be a satellite. this was very similar to that one except it was much smaller. both times i refer to it as if someone turned on a flashlight very high in the sky just for a moment and then turned it off. this is the best way i know of describing it.
content.summary: One round bright flash of light lasted only a few seconds

content.detailedDescription:
The pic says it all . the yellow lights below in the pic are beach lights and the white dot on top of the pic is the ufo . there are many ufo's here in cochin . u can mistake them for stars except they move .


i have been seeing these ufo's for months now . i think they are scouting for abducting me and the indian govt already knows about it as there are planes all around . helicopters and fixed wing strike air craft . the ufo's dont make any noise . they are not afraid of the govt planes .

if you get in touch with me then i can show them to you . later you can get a alienology expert team here to cochin and catch the greatest ufo scoop of the mellianium . namely a stand off between them( aliens) and the govt .
content.summary: Seen ufos like this for months now , cochin , india

content.detailedDescription: I was driving to work traveling south on the four lane and observed a "star/planet like" object to the south approximately 30 degrees above the horizon (i had to lean forward a little to observe the object while driving)> at first it appeared to be very far away as a star or planet would be. i say "as a planet would be" because it was as bright as venus or jupiter would appear if it was at night - brighter than a star. at first i thought it might be a planet, but i do not remember seeing any planet that brightly in that position this time of year nor at this time of day. at one point i said to myself, "i guess it could be a star." then i looked around to see if i could see any other stars in the sky and i could not - it was too light out by that time in the morning - it was a bright and clear october morning and the sun had not risen above the horizon yet, but there was enough sunlight that no stars could be seen by this time. i was now quite curious as to what the object might be and considered that it might be the landing lights on a large passenger jet coming in for a landing at the airport which is also south by several miles from my observation point. however after observing the object (which appeared to be stationary) for a couple of minutes (the object also appeared at first appeared to be thousands of miles away and then seemed to be much closer - like an airplane with it's landing lights on - though this light seemed much too bright to be the landing lights of an aircraft that far away). then i thought that it might be a ufo and having read many accounts of people seeing ufos i determined to communicat with the object mentally (i know that sounds weird, but i have read that people have done this and i thought "why not? let's just see what happens!") and i "said" to it - "if you are a ufo, come closer so i can take a really good look at you, but if you are an airplane, then continue doing what you are doing." at that point the object "disappeared". it didn't "fade out" like turning a large dc powered lamp or light off (or like a jetliner turning during an approach pattern). one second it was "there" and in a split second later it was "gone". then i observed what i will describe as "strobes" or quick "flashes of light". they were so tiny and so quick, i questioned whether i had actually seen them or if i was imagining them. there were two strobes/flashes of light. one to the left of the original position of the bright object and one to the right  of the original position of the bright object which i initially observed (and the "flashes" might possibly have occured at a slightly different elevation than the original bright stationary object).
content.summary: Star/planet like object in southern sky approximately 30 degrees above horizon observed for a few minutes before "disappearing".

content.detailedDescription: I was a sophomore attending bonanza high school west of the las vegas strip. a couple friends and i were skateboarding in a parking lot around dusk 7-8pm approximate area of jones and alta looking east towards lake mead (the lake). now i have lived close too nellis air force base and attended plenty of airshows so i know exactly the maneuvers and speeds that can be obtained. the four lights i saw were in a perfectly straight line they appeared just above the mountain top quite a distance from the strip they seem to have hovered for a second or two then moved very rapidly in a shaking or z shape then very suddenly disappeared. this event took place all in about a few seconds but very distinct and burned an image in my head that has prompted me to share because of the such rapid rate of movement and synchronized (spacing) of the lights at which they moved. once again it was so fast i was not sure if anyone i was with seen the same thing nor did i even mention it at the time and i have never really mentioned it to anyone since (13yrs)??
content.summary: Quick four lights shook then dissapeared very rapidly upwards

content.detailedDescription:
i was driving on lucknow road in lee county, south carolina, going to a nightclub, to meet with some friends and have a few drinks.  as i turned onto lucknow road off of pinchum sly road, i saw three white(not bright yellow or similarly incandescent)lights in the distance.  aware that a home was in that very vicinity, i first speculated that it was yard lighting.
     as i got closer, i realized these lights were over the tree tops that line the property boundary.  i immediately let of the gas pedal and allowed my vehicle to coast.  these lights were stationary there were no multiple flashing lights to suggest planes or helicopters.  these lights were positioned so that i could determine shadows (or diffusion of the light) through the limbs of the trees below the lights.  i reached a distance of fifty to seventy-five yards from the location below the closet light when all lights went out simultaneously.  i was traveling at about 25mph at that moment and lowered my window in case i could hear motors or rotors, i heard nothing but my tires on the pavement and the rush of air at that speed.  i continued to the club at a much accelerated speed constantly checking my mirrors(just in case).
     i was actually uncomfortable with this experience.  at the very moment of the experience i had a terrible sense of dread.  i felt as though i should immediately go home.  i have remained silent about this incident.  i am not certain if it is from fear or the stigma attached to claimants of sightings.  in either case, this is the first and only report i have made of the incident.

thank you.
content.summary: Lights over a residential home in a farming community

content.detailedDescription:
This is same siting but date/time on previous posting is erroneous.  my apologies for not setting the time zone correctly. 

i reported it the same night i saw it a few hours after seeing it tonight, thursday november 4 at approx dusk, 6 pm (sunset was at 5:44 pm), nothing else is changed, this siting corroborates the previous siting earlier today in southern california, that description matches what i saw (my corrected vision is pretty good, i would not say excellent), i had the right glasses on and the weather here was exactly what the other witness reported, warm, dry, no wind, very still.
content.summary: White blue glowing oval changing to comet (corrected time/date)

content.detailedDescription:
I have no photos of the event because it occurred in my dream (if it was a dream).  i remember lying awake in my and turning over on my stomach.  my bed is next to my wall.  the next thing i remember, this is in my "dream", i wake up; i can't move as i'm on my stomach and my bed is in the middle of my room.  i look around and see 7 figures standing around me.  each of them are wearing a black trench coat type clothing or robe, and their fingers are somewhat tentacle like.  i remember starting to feel terrified for some reason as they looked at me and i was telling myself to wake up but could not.  this went on for at least 4-5 minutes.  finally, i "wake up" but i'm on my back, instead of my stomach, and my bed was moved an inch or so from where it was earlier.  i've never woken up so terrified in my life.  ever.  i can still remember the dream as if it were yesterday.  never been so vivid and i haven't had the dream since.


also, before this, i was in the military in kuwait.  it was summer of 2008, i think.  anyways, i was sitting in my truck looking up at the stars and i noticed a bright star that was moving in an odd manner.  at first the object was moving fast.  then it slowed, sped up, and slowed down again.  after doing that for a few minutes it stopped completely and then it started to get smaller and dimmer.  not more than 2 minutes later, two military jets came into the area and circled around for about 5-10 minutes.  the star had disappeared so the jets flew away back to where they came.  can't explain it.
content.summary: Possible abduction
